speaker: COP 1
line: Yeah, how're ya doing?

speaker: GUY IN CAR
line: Quite a little party. What do you know?

speaker: COP 1
line: Reports that there were shots fired. The door looks like it's been jimmied. The alarm wasn't tripped.

speaker: GUY IN CAR
line: You see anybody come out?

speaker: COP 1
line: Not a soul. Whoever it is, he's still in there. COP 1 motions for his men to go into the building. In the building, they walk up the stairwell with their flashlights on. One by one, covering each other, they enter a warehouse room filled with crates, dark.

speaker: COP 2
line: Lieutenant, over here. COP 1 turns with his gun at ready and looks at the ground. Blood.

speaker: COP 2
line: Look here. Looks like someone got hit.

speaker: COP 1
line: So where'd he go? Stay low and keep looking. They slowly search again. COP 1 hears groaning. He turns and sees a large piece of cardboard leaning against a crate. The moaning is coming from underneath. He slowly walks toward it. He talks into the headset communication.

speaker: COP 1
line: Davis! Gonzalez!

speaker: DAVIS AND GONZALEZ
line: Yeah. They join him. He slowly lifts the cardboard. A naked man. He's groaning with his arm over his face. It's Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're here....

speaker: COP 1
line: Are you all right?

speaker: MULDER
line: They're here...

speaker: COP 1
line: Who's here? He motions for the two to check it out. We follow one of them as he moves to another section and lifts a wooden slat door. Three figures pop up and run away.

speaker: COP 2
line: Hey, stop. Police! One of the men falls and the other two stop by him with their arms raised. It's Frohike on the floor, Langly and Byers!

speaker: LANGLY
line: Don't shoot!

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We didn't do it.

speaker: COP 2
line: Didn't do what?

speaker: BYERS
line: Whatever.

speaker: COP 2
line: Face down on the floor! They slowly kneel down as the other MP comes with his gun pointed at them. They go stomach to the floor.

speaker: COP 2
line: Get down! Get down! All right. Cuff 'em. Spread 'em. The cops frisk them as they hear the shouting again.

speaker: MULDER
line: THEY'RE HERE! THEY'RE HERE!

speaker: LANGLY
line: We're screwed. Thank you so much for getting me involved in this, DOO-hickey.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Frohike, you hippie jerk.

speaker: LANGLY
line: DOO-hickey! Frohike stands with his finger pointed. Langly stands and towers over him.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Ya know, with that long blonde hair, you'll be the first one in here that gets traded for cigarettes. I'm gonna be laughing my ass off.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Oh yeah? Ya wanna cha-cha.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Anytime, any place. Byers turns.

speaker: BYERS
line: Both of you relax!

speaker: LANGLY
line: Shut up, ya narc!

speaker: FROHIKE
line: It's your fault we're here.

speaker: GUARD
line: You, you with the suit. You're first. Byers turns, scared.

speaker: MUNCH
line: Detective Munch, Baltimore Homicide.

speaker: BYERS
line: Did they find her?

speaker: MUNCH
line: And a good evening to you. Sorry, no sign of your mystery lady.

speaker: BYERS
line: She is real, the FBI agent saw her.

speaker: MUNCH
line: Yeah well, Special Agent .. Mulder? Is currently being held under five-point restraints and jabbering like a monkey. And the FBI's not talking either. So, what I'm looking at here is a warehouse break-in with nothing stolen, a shoot-out but no guns, lots of blood but no bodies. And an FBI agent who likes to take off all his clothes and talk about space aliens. Fill me in. From the top, start with your name and birth date.

speaker: BYERS
line: John Fitzgerald Byers, 11/22/63.

speaker: MUNCH
line: Seriously.

speaker: BYERS
line: I was named after JFK. Before the assassination, my parents were going to call me Bertram.

speaker: MUNCH
line: Lucky you. Occupation?

speaker: BYERS
line: I work for the government... for the moment.

speaker: MUNCH
line: What do you do for the government?

speaker: BYERS
line: I'm a public affairs officer for the Federal Communications Commission. It was in that capacity that I was attending the Computer and Electronics Show at the Baltimore Convention Center.

speaker: BYERS' VOICE OVER
line: Just this morning. We at the FCC enjoy forging positive ties with the American public. It's our way of saying 'Communication is just another word for sharing'. He lifts a glass jar full of buttons to two hippies walking past. <Rumor has it they are writers on the show>.

speaker: BYERS
line: Hi, guys. Like a button?

speaker: HIPPIES
line: Up yours, narc.

speaker: BYERS' VOICE OVER
line: Of course some people don't see it like that. They walk right on by. In the distance, he sees a blonde woman wearing sunglasses walking toward him. It's slow motion as she gets closer. Byers is awestruck.

speaker: BYERS' VOICE OVER
line: At any rate, that was where I first saw her. She gets to the booth, lowers her glasses, flashes her eyes at Byers.

speaker: BYERS
line: Would you like a... a button? She walks on.

speaker: BYERS' VOICE OVER
line: I'm still not sure why I did what I did. It was so unlike me. There was just something about her. Byers goes behind the curtain to a man at a computer playing Dig Dug. <It's Ken Hawryliw playing Ken Hawryliw! He works for the show> Byers bends to him.

speaker: BYERS
line: Ken, I'm going to take a short break, okay?

speaker: KEN
line: Yeah, all right.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hello pretty lady! He kicks into his salesman mode.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Picture this, crystal-clear television, 33 channels worth with no monthly cable bill.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Excuse me?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Now! Now I know what you're thinking. Melvin? Are you out of your mind? No cable bill? That's exactly what I'm saying, and I'm talking premium channels here too. You got your HBO, you got your Cinemax, you got your Showtime. All courtesy of this modestly priced marvel designed and built by the Frohike Electronics Corporation. He pulls out what looks like a VCR/TV splitter. Langly comes up from behind a dividing curtain to his own booth.

speaker: LANGLY
line: There's a name that inspires consumer confidence.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Shut up, punk! Where were we? Langly pulls the curtain away, we see his booth and name, Langly Vision.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Hey lady, if you want to watch Matlock with Andy Griffith all blue and squiggly, go right ahead and buy from this guy. But, if you want quality bootleg cable, you talk to me.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: If you want a converter that'll short out and burn your house down, definitely talk to this guy.

speaker: LANGLY
line: It was a one time fluke. I heat cinque every mother board.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Yeah, well what about coax laws? Use the RG6U or the 52 All Mar GH?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Trick question. They continue their discussion as Susanne walks on, Byers following. Susanne turns a corner and bumps into Byers. Her purse falls to the floor.

speaker: BYERS
line: Sorry. He bends to help her pick up the belongings of her purse. He picks up a picture of a little girl.

speaker: BYERS
line: She's very cute.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Yeah. She is. Thank you.

speaker: BYERS
line: Wait! She turns.

speaker: BYERS
line: Um, ah... You just look like you could use some help. TABLE Susanne and Byers are talking over coffee.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: So my daughter turned 3 years old last week. Last Tuesday was her birthday. I hope he remembered that... She softly cries.

speaker: BYERS
line: Her... her father... took her from you?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: My former boyfriend. He kidnaped her. Byers is surprised.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: It's a long story. Basically I got involved with a man who turned out to be a complete psychotic.

speaker: BYERS
line: Yeah?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: We were only together a few months... I was attracted to him because he was dark and mysterious. And then he just kept getting darker and more mysterious. I got pregnant and he left. She sniffs back a sob.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: And then he suddenly came back and took her about 6 months ago.

speaker: BYERS
line: That's terrible. Did you call the police?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Of course. The police and private investigators. They were surprisingly unhelpful.

speaker: BYERS
line: That's unbelievable.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Yeah... well. At least I managed to get a couple of leads. I was told he was in the Baltimore area. So here I am.

speaker: BYERS
line: Well, that's a start...

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Yeah... Except that he now knows that I'm looking for him. And the closer I get the more dangerous he becomes.

speaker: BYERS
line: Are you... worried he might... harm your daughter?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Let's just say I want to find her, not him. She hands him a piece of paper with the words "Arpanet/Whtcorp/" written on it.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: This is the only other lead I've got. That's why I'm here today. This has something to do with computers. Doesn't it? The internet?

speaker: BYERS
line: Actually, the Orpanet. It's a government network created by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency... You can access it through the internet.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Somehow this means something to my ex-boyfriend. I was hoping it was a means to finding my daughter. Long pause as Byers decides if he's going to get involved.

speaker: BYERS
line: If you want... Bingo!

speaker: BYERS
line: I could go online... try to find out for you.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Would you? That... I would really, really appreciate that.

speaker: BYERS
line: Um, by the way, my name's John. Susanne sees a packet of Holly brand sugar on the table.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Holly. She smiles.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Nice to meet you.

speaker: BYERS
line: Holly. He smiles.

speaker: BYERS
line: Just like the sugar.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Yeah... just like the sugar.

speaker: BYERS
line: Funny...

speaker: BYERS
line: Ken, can you take a short break? Ken loses the game and shrugs.

speaker: KEN
line: Whatever... Ken gets up and leaves. Byers sits in the chair.

speaker: BYERS
line: Ok... let's see. He logs onto the net.

speaker: BYERS
line: So your ex-boyfriend is into computers?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: I don't really know. I knew very little about him. Except that he's psychotic.

speaker: BYERS
line: Somehow this kicked us into the Defense Data Network. He looks at the screen. Need ID.

speaker: BYERS
line: I'm sorry, I think this is the end of the line.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Isn't there something you could... how do you say it? Hack into? Byers is shocked!

speaker: BYERS
line: Hack into? No! I... I mean, technically, yes. I probably could. But this belongs to the Department of Defense. This is a secured site. I mean I work for the FCC. This is the kind of thing we're trying to stop.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Thank you, John. I appreciate your time. She starts to leave.

speaker: BYERS
line: Wait... He stops and thinks.

speaker: BYERS
line: You didn't see this. He punches on the keyboard. They're in.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: What did you do?

speaker: BYERS
line: Oh, government system. I know a couple of logon tricks with VMS Version 5... Never mind. He punches some more keys.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Can you look up Susanne Modeski? That's my daughter.

speaker: BYERS
line: I'll try. There's just no way of telling... A strange screen comes up.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: What is that?

speaker: BYERS
line: It's an encrypted file. Why would your three year old have an encrypted file with the Secret Defense Department Data Base?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Can you decode it?

speaker: BYERS
line: I'd need some help.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Can you print it out for me? She walks to the printer as Byers punches more keys. After it prints and she tears it off, she looks through a gap in the curtain.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: My God!

speaker: BYERS
line: What? Byers and Susanne gather at the curtain gap.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: My ex-boyfriend is out there.

speaker: BYERS
line: The psychotic?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: He must have tracked me here. He's looking for me. Damn it! There he is.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You look like a gentleman who could appreciate 33 channels crystal-clear television.

speaker: MULDER
line: No thanks, handsome. Mulder keeps walking.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Oh, a man of distinction... Punk ass.

speaker: BYERS' VOICE OVER
line: It was at this point we enlisted the help of one Melvin Frohike... computer hacker. Susanne and Byers go to Frohike's booth.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hello pretty lady... Yeah. What's with the narc?

speaker: BYERS
line: I continued to tell him the entire story. I hoped he could assist me in deciphering the encrypted file.

speaker: BYERS' VOICE OVER
line: It was at this point however that Mr. Frohike raised an interesting question.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I don't understand, why don't you just kick this guy's ass?

speaker: BYERS
line: What?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: No. I just want these pages decoded, can you do that?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Sure, baby, my kung fu is the best, but it could take hours, I say cut to the chase. If pretty boy out there can tell us where your daughter is, we just need to go beat it out of him.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Bad idea. He's very dangerous.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Lady, I'm dangerous. All right, so, we just won't. For all we know he's got the girl here somewhere.

speaker: BYERS
line: Holly, it makes sense.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: No! Just stay away from him.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We'll stay back a ways. Just wait for us here. Come on! Frohike and Byers leave. Susanne is worried. Not about them getting beat up, but rather they'd find out the truth. LATER They hide from Mulder but Byers watches him from a distance. Frohike has a virtual reality helmet on.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What's he doing?

speaker: BYERS
line: Talking to somebody. Frohike lifts the face plate and looks at Mulder.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: This dude doesn't look so tough. Mulder turns and walks toward them. Frohike flips the face plate down.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Act casual. BOOTH As they walk on, a voice from a booth booms out at the people milling around.

speaker: VOICE
line: Alien presence is among us... They're here.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, fellas... You looking for somebody?

speaker: BYERS
line: Just um.... the bathroom.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think it's down here. Hey, you with the FCC?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What's it to you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think we share the same credit union. Special Agent Fox Mulder I'm with the... a... Federal Bureau of Investigation. I was hoping maybe you could help me. I'm... m... looking for a girl. I was wondering if you've seen her. He shows them a picture of 'Holly'. Byers' eyes go wide. Frohike, ever the smoothy, is surprised but doesn't show it.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Sorry.

speaker: BYERS
line: What did she do?

speaker: MULDER
line: What's it to you? Thanks, guys. All right? A loud cell phone rings. Mulder takes this humongous old time cell phone out of his pocket and answers it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, Mulder... Oh hey, Reggie... What's up? Frohike and Byers walk away.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What the hell was that all about?

speaker: BYERS
line: He's with the FBI?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hey, where'd she go? Byers' Dig-Dug buddy is dragged away by the MP's.

speaker: KEN
line: Just take your hands away from me.

speaker: KEN
line: Come on.

speaker: BYERS
line: Ken?

speaker: KEN
line: All I did was play Dig Dug. I didn't hack into anybody's computer. Seriously guys. I have like a circulatory problem. I have a tendency to...

speaker: BYERS
line: Wait!... It was me.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What are you doing?

speaker: BYERS
line: *I* hacked into their computer. Frohike pulls him aside.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: So you're gonna turn yourself in, are you crazy? A hacker never turns himself in!

speaker: BYERS
line: I am not a *hacker*.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Listen, we got FBI agents running around, military police. Whatever the hell is going on around here, it's big. And your lady friend is somehow at the center of it all.

speaker: BYERS
line: She needs my help. How can we learn what's going on?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The FBI are looking for her, hack into the FBI mainframe. I know just the guy who can do it.

speaker: BYERS
line: You are talking about a pre-meditated crime against the United States government.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hey, your second one today. Welcome to the dark side.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Okay ladies, who's down for fifty?... Fifty bucks... Anyone?... Fifty bucks... Oh man, my diaper-wearing granny would bet fifty!... Come on!... There's no game here.

speaker: MAN
line: Alright, fifty.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Elron the Druid bets fifty. Cash only, Elron, I don't take no personal checks from the Bank of Middle Earth. Langly takes dice and begins to rattle them in his hands.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Come on natural 20, Daddy needs a new sword of wounding. The door opens letting light flood into the room, Frohike and Byers are standing there, Langly jumps up and rushes to the door.

speaker: LANGLY
line: What's the big idea bringing the narc in here?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Me and the narc have a proposition for you.

speaker: LANGLY
line: What proposition?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The coolest hack in the world.

speaker: ANOTHER MAN
line: Lord Manhammer...

speaker: LANGLY
line: Say it.... Say it.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Your kung fu is the best. Langly grins.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Here... make yourself useful. He hands the plug to Byers.

speaker: BYERS
line: What does this do?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Besides over heat? Burn the hotel down?

speaker: LANGLY
line: It's a lube line shunt. Anyone who tries to trace will get passed around by CMT. It call forwarding software. My personal invention. He clicks onto the computer.

speaker: BYERS
line: Oh, I'm going to get fired... I'm going to go to jail... I deserve to go to jail.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Shut up already. What do you need me to do?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Just watch and learn. He clicks around and a screen pops up.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Bingo. Government hack is a snap. Last week I got into the Maryland DMV. Changed my endorsement so I can handicap park. Pause.

speaker: LANGLY
line: I got tinnitus. What now?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Look up the FBI agent. What'd he say his name was?

speaker: BYERS
line: Mulder. Langly types in. Screen pops up with generic information on Agent Fox Mulder with a picture of him.

speaker: LANGLY
line: That your boy?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Fox William Mulder. Born 10-13-1961. Degree in psychology from Oxford University. Top of his class at Quantico. Commendations up the ying yang. Currently attached to the Violent Crimes Unit. Single. Nothing in here about him being a psycho or having a daughter.

speaker: BYERS
line: Try under active cases, Holly Modeski. Langly enters the information.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Nada. No case file.

speaker: BYERS
line: Try the daughter, Susanne Modeski. Langly enters and a file turns up with 'Holly's' picture.

speaker: BYERS
line: She's Susanne Modeski?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Employee at the Army Advanced Weapon Facility at White Stone, NM.

speaker: BYERS
line: Whtcorp....

speaker: LANGLY
line: Oh, man. Look at this... Says here she blew up one of their labs, killed four people. Including the MP who tried to stop her at the gate.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Subject Modeski is considered unstable and delusional. Intellectually brilliant yet prone to confabulation and fits of violent behavior.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Psychotic and profoundly paranoid.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Armed and extremely dangerous. Do not approach. Call immediately for back up. The door knob turns. The men gasp. The door opens. It's Susanne. She enters and locks the door behind her.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: You're reading about me. Pause. She looks at Byers.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: My name is Susanne Modeski not Holly. I'm... I was an organic chemist for the Advanced Weapons Facility... But I never blew up any lab and I certainly never killed anybody. All I did was try to quit. Not have a job, just quit.

speaker: BYERS
line: What about your daughter?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: I don't have one. I'm sorry...

speaker: BYERS
line: The photo?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: It came with the wallet. You wouldn't have believed the truth, obviously and I desperately needed you to help.

speaker: BYERS
line: With what, exactly?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: To get this. She holds the print out.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: I still need it deciphered. This has in it everything I need to expose the United States government's plot against it's own people. One I unwittingly helped to form by developing the Ergotimene histamine gas.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Ergotomine...

speaker: SUSANNE
line: EH for short. It's an aerosolized gas which in small doses caused anxiety paranoia in it's subject.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Paranoia. Got ya.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Secret forces within the government plan to test this gas on the American people right here in Baltimore! The Lone Gunmen all look at each other, figuring she's flipped her lid.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: I am not making this up. Don't you get it, nobody is safe! Look what they did to JFK!

speaker: BYERS
line: What did they do to JFK?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Dallas? 1963? Hello?! They want to control every aspect of our lives, from the cradle to the grave. They practically do already. She starts pulling open the drawers next to the hotel beds as the boys exchange looks, and finally pulls out a Bible.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Hotel Bible, who do you think put this here?

speaker: LANGLY
line: The government?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: One in every hotel room in America, it's the perfect vessel for electronic surveillance. No one ever questions its presence.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Now, I'm sorry, you're telling me that the US government, the same government that gave us Amtrak...

speaker: LANGLY
line: Not to mention the Susan B. Anthony dollar.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: ... is behind some of the darkest, most far-reaching conspiracies on the planet?! That's just crazy!

speaker: LANGLY
line: I mean, like, this guy works for the government.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: I'll prove it to you, just help me decipher this. As she picks up the file, her gun falls to the floor, startling the boys.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: What do you say guys?

speaker: BYERS' VOICE OVER
line: Of course, at that point, we didn't feel like we had much choice.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Langly, what's taking so long?

speaker: LANGLY
line: I should be up any second.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Oh, yeah. Here we go. He types.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Thank God for super computers. is a blow to the program but not a fatal one. The time table remains unchanged. First EBO will occur in the Baltimore-Washington area within one week's time.

speaker: LANGLY
line: What's an EBO?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Engineered Biological Operation. Toxic organic agents used on humans. team has been processed and plausible denial constructed.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Which is another way of saying that they murdered my research associates and placed the blame on me. Now do you understand? She looks at the screen again.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Wait. Here it is. EH product is presently warehoused at 204 Falls Point Road. Lot number A900 awaiting EBO. This is it...

speaker: BYERS
line: "Subject Modeski currently monitored around the clock. Covert electronics installed per Dr. Michael Killborn 11-6-88." Who's Dr. Michael Killborn?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: My dentist. Excuse me. She takes a pair of pliers and goes into the bathroom.

speaker: BYERS
line: What do you think?

speaker: LANGLY
line: That... thing about her dentist... BATHROOM Byers opens the door and cautiously looks inside.

speaker: BYERS
line: Dr. Modeski? He goes into the room. Susanne is standing at the sink with blood all over, and a tooth in the pliers.

speaker: BYERS
line: Get in here! He rushes to her and Langly and Frohike appear at the door.

speaker: BYERS
line: My God!

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Look at it... Look at it!

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Am I seeing what I think I'm seeing? We see a bug in the filling of the tooth.

speaker: BYERS
line: What was the address of that warehouse?

speaker: MUNCH
line: Where's the tooth?

speaker: BYERS
line: We flushed it. We were afraid it would give away our location. Munch just looks at him.

speaker: BYERS
line: So... we broke into the warehouse.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Here it is! There's a carton with a large sign reading A9000.

speaker: LANGLY
line: A9000, right? Susanne cuts the carton open. She takes out a small box the carton is full of.

speaker: BYERS
line: Asthma medicine...

speaker: SUSANNE
line: This is how they plan on distributing the gas. It's asthma inhalers. This is their random test! Now I've got proof.

speaker: MULDER'S VOICE
line: Stay where you are. They turn and see Mulder walking toward them with his gun pointed at them.

speaker: MULDER
line: Federal agent. Susanne Modeski, you are under arrest for the murders of four people at White Stone Army Base.

speaker: BYERS
line: She didn't do it!

speaker: FROHIKE
line: She's innocent.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: You three are under arrest also. Susanne starts to move away.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ma'am, stay where you are.

speaker: BYERS
line: Just listen... There's more going on here than meets the eye.

speaker: MULDER
line: You three get on the ground now! Ma'am, stop moving. I'm not going to ask you again. The men get on the floor. Determined footsteps are coming in the building. Two men walk up to them.

speaker: MAN
line: Susanne Modeski, please come with us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Federal agent, identify yourself.

speaker: MAN
line: Ma'am, come with us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Step forward and identify yourselves, NOW! Shots ring out, Mulder dives for cover. The Gunmen run behind some other boxes across the room. The inhaler carton is riddled with bullet holes. Mulder lies on the ground by it. The chemical that spills out of the carton gets on Mulder, who starts moaning and wreathing around on the floor. He takes his shirt off. The man walks up to Mulder and is about to shoot him. Susanne shoots the guy first. Mulder is in a daze. Lone gunmen come out from behind the boxes.

speaker: BYERS
line: Susanne! Behind them, a large garage door opens and light filters into the room. MPs walk in with detectors of some sort. Another man walks in and ahead of the cops. He walks past the Gunmen with another man. It's X. He stops at Mulder.

speaker: X
line: Sanitize it. Mulder hallucinates. The clean up men are aliens. Their voices are distorted.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're here. The man shot by Susanne is put into a body bag.

speaker: MAN
line: I'm alive! They zip him up anyway. He keeps screaming "I'm alive!" from inside the bag.

speaker: BYERS
line: Who are you people?! A crate mover is driven in.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Whoa! They move out of its way. The boxes are taped up. The floor is vacuumed and cleaned. X supervises.

speaker: BYERS
line: What authority do you have to do this?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Shut up, Byers! X glares at them and walks over to Mulder lying on the floor.

speaker: CLEAN-UP GUY
line: Bag him? X leans over Mulder.

speaker: X
line: No one touches this man.

speaker: BYERS
line: Excuse me.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Byers...

speaker: BYERS
line: Sir! X looks at him and walks over.

speaker: BYERS
line: Why are you doing this? You people framed Susanne Modeski, you plan to test that chemical on an unwitting public. Why? For what possible reason?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Byers, shut up!

speaker: BYERS
line: Who gives you the authority?

speaker: X
line: No bags. The boys are forced to their knees, hands in the air, X checks the gun and walks behind them. He points his gun at Byers' head, pulls the trigger and... click. The gun was empty.

speaker: X
line: Behave yourselves. He begins to walks away.

speaker: BYERS
line: That's it? Just trying to intimidate us, to scare us so we'll keep quiet?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Byers, I swear to God, I'll shoot you myself.

speaker: BYERS
line: It's all true what Susanne said about you people, isn't it? About John F. Kennedy? Dallas?

speaker: X
line: I heard it was a lone gunman. X walks out as the door shuts and distant cop sirens are heard.

speaker: BYERS' VOICE OVER
line: That was the last we saw of him.

speaker: BYERS
line: Almost immediately, the police got there. We panicked and hid. You know the rest.

speaker: MUNCH
line: Do I look like Geraldo to you? Don't lie to me like I'm Geraldo, I'm *not* Geraldo!

speaker: LANGLY
line: Oh man, not all a bad dream. I am in hell. He sits up.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Women...

speaker: LANGLY
line: Ain't it the truth.

speaker: BYERS
line: What do you mean, women?

speaker: LANGLY
line: You know exactly what he means. Your molar pulling girlfriend pulled us in and left us swinging in the breeze. Byers looks at Frohike.

speaker: BYERS
line: Is that what you meant?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Look... she is hot. But you've got to admit, we're here because of her.

speaker: BYERS
line: I'm here because I wanted to know the truth. I assumed that was the same for you. Susanne opened my eyes to it. She doesn't owe me anything. It there was some way I could... help her still, I'd do it in a second.

speaker: MUNCH
line: Apparently Agent Mulder came to and verified your warehouse story, or at least what little he seems to recall of it. Three cheers for the FBI, you guys are free to go. Come on, let's go. Here's a tip, aluminum foil makes a lovely hat and it blocks out the government's mind control rays. Keep you guys out of trouble.

speaker: COP
line: One green nylon wallet containing 38 dollars in cash. Langly takes it. The cop puts a whatever the hell this is on the desk.

speaker: COP
line: One... whatever the hell this is. Munch looks at it. It's I think a splitter. He takes it. Another cop comes in.

speaker: OTHER COP
line: Detective? Munch turns.

speaker: OTHER COP
line: We got a stolen car that turned up at the train station. It's the one that the FBI agent was driving. Munch nods and leaves with the other cop.

speaker: BYERS
line: Susanne must have taken Mulder's car last night. She left it at the train station.

speaker: LANGLY
line: So?

speaker: BYERS
line: So maybe we can catch up with her.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Where? She took a train.

speaker: BYERS
line: She's too smart for that. You see... she... she just meant to throw them off.

speaker: LANGLY
line: She said she wanted to go public.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The Baltimore Guardian is only a couple of blocks down from the train station.

speaker: BYERS
line: Susanne! Langly and Frohike knock a guy down on the sidewalk and help him get up.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You okay?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: They didn't believe my story. Not a word of it. Who in their right mind would?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What are you going to do now?

speaker: SUSANNE
line: Try other newspapers... TV stations... Not give up. Keep trying to find people who will listen. People like you... I appreciate what you did for me. All three of you.

speaker: BYERS
line: We still want to help. Susanne touches his cheek. They kiss.

speaker: SUSANNE
line: You already have. A pay phone rings next to them.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Guys...

speaker: SUSANNE
line: No matter how paranoid you are, you're not paranoid enough. Tell the truth. Reach as many people as you can with it. That's your weapon. She walks away. At the end of the block, a black car comes around the corner and stops. Another car stops at the end, blocking her path. She runs back and men from the first car get her.

speaker: BYERS
line: Susanne! She is put into the first car and they drive off in slow motion. The back smoked glass window is closed but the gunmen see X clearly.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Ya feeling better?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah I am, thank you, I just... mmm... I have these weird ideas in my head that I can't seem to shake.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What kind of ideas?

speaker: MULDER
line: Weird ones.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Ya gonna bust us?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not sure yet, I just spoke with my ASAC and he tells me that Dr. Susanne Modeski is no longer wanted by the FBI. She's still missing, but the case has suddenly closed. What I need from you guys is to tell me what the hell happened last night.

speaker: BYERS
line: You want the truth?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I want the truth.

speaker: BYERS
line: You might want to sit down, this is gonna take a while. They all sit down.

speaker: BYERS
line: The truth is... none of us is safe. Secret elements within the United States government seek to surveil us and control our lives.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?!

speaker: LANGLY
line: Tell him about the hotel room Bibles.

speaker: BYERS
line: Yeah, I'm coming to that. Okay, it all started with Susanne Modeski...
